Html:
Hello,

All DateTimePickers on the form some time show time in incorrect format. That depends on current regional settings. If regional settings use a 24 hour clock form translates the time into 12 hour format without AM/PM notations. And it is impossible to set a time for PM preriod.
When you pull up the equivalent trigger editor from the Windows "Task Scheduler" applet (Windows-R, "Taskschd.msc"), does it have the same limitations? I'm using the same .NET control.
Also, if you can. please provide the precise regional settings that cause the problem. Can I just set the 24 hour clock option with any language to get the result you've found?

Windows "Task Scheduler" doesn't have this limitation.
I noticed that your control has custom format. If I try to change it to "Time" format time will be displaed right.
The issue is reprodusible when regional settings use 24 hour time format that does not display leading zero. For example:
Thank you for the detail. I am working to resolve it for the next release.
This discussion has been copied to a work item. Click here to go to the work item and continue the discussion.
